intro: Octomeria kestrochila, commonly known as the Kestrochila octomeria, is a flowering plant species native to the island of Madagascar. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves with five to seven lobes and produces small, clustered flowers with five petals. It is typically found in humid, shaded environments within the rainforests of Madagascar. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
